Renekton unarguably has the worst passive in the game, and the 'why' is pretty simple.

His passive is a literal description of how his resource is generated and works.

He gains 50% more of this resource when below 50% health.
no mana is nice, and his fury enhances his abilities in strong ways

> [{quoted}](name=Meat Feast,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=vEOZyLxL,comment-id=000d0000,timestamp=2018-03-18T17:03:07.657+0000)
>
> no mana is nice, and his fury enhances his abilities in strong ways

.. Are you daft?

This isn't a thread about mana less vs mana users. The point is that Renekton's 'passive' ability is an explanation of his resource, both generation and use, and nothing more. It exists only to explain his gameplay but does not enhance it.

That's like if Zed's passive was an explanation of how energy worked and also the "hit two spells, regen energy" bit from his W. It would entirely be an explanation of his resource and how it's generated, with no effects on gameplay other than the clarity of how he functioned.
did you miss the part about how it enhances his abilities in strong ways?

But that isn't his passive, it is his resource. His passive (Reign of Anger) reads as follows

> INNATE: Renekton generates 5 Fury each time he lands a basic attack on a non-structure, losing 4 Fury per second if he hasn't dealt or taken damage in the last 12 seconds.
> 
> When at/above 50 Fury, Renekton's next basic ability consumes 50 Fury to enhance its effects (does not generate Fury).
> 
> REIGN OF ANGER: Renekton gains 50% more Fury from all sources while below 50% maximum health.

So literally it is a description of his resource and his actual passive is the last bit on gaining more fury when low on health.
